points: Notify the landlord in writing of your intention to move out.
Ensure the notice period complies with the lease agreement.
Coordinate with the landlord to schedule a move-out inspection.
Prepare the property for the inspection.
Begin packing non-essential items early.
Label boxes clearly to identify contents.
Clean the entire property thoroughly, including carpets, windows, and appliances.
Remove any stains and repair minor damages.
Fix any damages caused during the tenancy.
Patch holes in walls and touch up paint where needed.
Dispose of or donate items you no longer need.
Arrange for the removal of large items if necessary.
Move all your belongings out of the property.
Ensure nothing is left behind.
Conduct a final walk-through with the landlord.
Discuss any last-minute issues or concerns.
Return all keys to the landlord, including mailbox and garage keys.
Hand over any access cards or remote controls.
Transfer utilities (water, electricity, gas) to your new address.
Cancel any services that are no longer needed.
Update your address with the post office, bank, employer, and other important services.
Notify friends and family of your new address.
Follow up with the landlord regarding the refund of your security deposit.
Ensure any deductions are itemized and justified.
